frameDefinitions: This frame concerns an Addict's physiological or psychological compulsive dependence on an Addictant, the substance or behavior to which the Addict is addicted. '' 'Although she was never a big fan of drugs, she became hooked on that designer drug instantly.'
A mutual social and personal relationship that keeps people involved in each other's lives comprises a Connection of Individual1 to Individual
The words in this frame have to do with people and the personal Relationships they are or can be a part of.
A Creator  produces a physical object which is to serve as a Representation of an actual or imagined entity or event, the Represented.
An Experiencer has an emotion as caused by a Stimulus or concerning a Topic.
A Resisting_entity is capable of resisting or does resist a physical Opposing_force to a level specified by the target.
frameExamples: Although she was never a big fan of drugs, she became <t>hooked</t> on that designer drug instantly.
They wanted to strengthen their family <t>ties</t>.
And of course that drippy <t><fex name='Partner_1'>boyfriend</fex></t> of hers backed her up.
Epstein saw the machine-man and <t>carved</t> him in shiny metal.
I fall asleep hours later to the sound of their <t>engrossed</t> murmuring.
The great and <t>impregnable</t> fortress still stands today.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Addict</fen> is physiologically or psychologically dependent on a substance or a behavior.
<fen>Addictant</fen> is the substance or behavior to which the <fen>Addict</fen> is dependent.
<fen>Individuals</fen> have a <fen>Connection</fen> with each other.
<fen>Individual1</fen> has a social <fen>Connection</fen> to <fen>Individual_2</fen>.
<fen>Individual2</fen> has a relationship to <fen>Individual_1</fen>.
<fen>Connection</fen> is the personal relationship between <fen>Individuals</fen> that keeps them involved in each other's lives.
That partner in the <fen>Relationship</fen> who is realized as the subject of verbs in active form sentences, or of adjectives in predicative uses.
That partner in the <fen>Relationship</fen> who is not expressed as the external argument.
The joint construal of both <fen>Partners</fen> in the <fen>Relationship</fen>.
An individual or individuals that bring the <fen>Representation</fen> into existence.
The entity--which may be a thing, an action or a state--that is represented by the <fen>Representation</fen>.
The time at which a <fen>Representation</fen> is created.
The location in which the artist produces the representation.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the general area in which the emotion occurs.  It indicates a range of possible <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>State</fen> is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.

The body part, gesture, or other expression of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that reflects his or her emotional state.  They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
The Time when the <fen>Experiencer</fen> is has a feeling about the <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
The <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> is the item that resists the <fen>Opposing_force</fen> to the level specified by the target.

The <fen>Opposing_force</fen> is the item placed in opposition to the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen>. <fen>Opposing_force</fen> hinders, blocks, helps, or allows (lets) the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> to resist at the level specified by the target. Sometimes this Core role is incorporated in the target; otherwise, it is often null instantiated in example sentences.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> resists an external force.
The location where the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> resists an external force.
listRoleExamples: Since <fex>Frans</fex> photographed them ten years ago the population has increased.
When Nadar photographed <fex>her</fex>, Desbordes-Valmore was sixty-eight.
I drew him <fex>at work</fex> a bunch of times, mainly for the amusement of the staff.
These are made from a tough <fex>plastic foam</fex> and are very light to wear.
The fortress was impregnable <fex>to attack by hostile invaders</fex>.
The retaining wall was even weaker <fex>yesterday</fex>, and had begun to crumble.
They decided the tree-house would be sturdiest <fex>in the big old backyard oak</fex>.
